name: Tempelhofer Feld (former airport)
full_description: A vast open space on a former airport runway where dogs can enjoy long, straight laps and wind‑in‑fur sprints. There are fenced dog runs on both the Neukölln and Tempelhof sides, plus miles of paved and grass routes for varied routines. Expect broad paths and mixed terrain that’s kind to paws, with shade pockets and benches for water breaks. Go early or at golden hour in summer to avoid heat; bring a collapsible bowl and extra bags. Leash rules vary by area—check signage at each entrance and respect protected habitats.

name: Großer Tiergarten
full_description: Berlin’s central green heart: leafy avenues, lakes, lawns and cafés woven between monuments. Leashed dogs can zigzag shaded paths and pause by the canals; it’s easy to stitch short or long loops together. Expect broad paths and mixed terrain that’s kind to paws, with shade pockets and benches for water breaks. Go early or at golden hour in summer to avoid heat; bring a collapsible bowl and extra bags. Leash rules vary by area—check signage at each entrance and respect protected habitats.

name: Grunewald & Grunewaldsee
full_description: Extensive forest crisscrossed by sandy trails around dog‑popular Grunewaldsee. Cool shade, soft footing and water access make it a year‑round favorite—watch for wildlife and follow posted rules. Expect broad paths and mixed terrain that’s kind to paws, with shade pockets and benches for water breaks. Go early or at golden hour in summer to avoid heat; bring a collapsible bowl and extra bags. Leash rules vary by area—check signage at each entrance and respect protected habitats.

name: Schlachtensee Circuit
full_description: A scenic loop around a clear forest lake with numerous benches and swim spots (check seasonal dog rules). Gently undulating path is great for steady pace walks. Expect broad paths and mixed terrain that’s kind to paws, with shade pockets and benches for water breaks. Go early or at golden hour in summer to avoid heat; bring a collapsible bowl and extra bags. Leash rules vary by area—check signage at each entrance and respect protected habitats.

name: Krumme Lanke
full_description: Another forest‑rimmed lake just south of Schlachtensee, with quieter banks and sandy coves. Combine both lakes for a longer day out. Expect broad paths and mixed terrain that’s kind to paws, with shade pockets and benches for water breaks. Go early or at golden hour in summer to avoid heat; bring a collapsible bowl and extra bags. Leash rules vary by area—check signage at each entrance and respect protected habitats.

name: Tegeler See & Greenwichpromenade
full_description: Waterside promenades with wide, flat paths, boat piers and breezy views. Nearby parks offer lawns for picnic breaks with leashed dogs. Expect broad paths and mixed terrain that’s kind to paws, with shade pockets and benches for water breaks. Go early or at golden hour in summer to avoid heat; bring a collapsible bowl and extra bags. Leash rules vary by area—check signage at each entrance and respect protected habitats.

name: Müggelsee (Nordufer & Müggelspree)
full_description: Berlin’s largest lake with long shoreline paths and breezy pine stands; some stretches allow dog access (observe signs). Great for all‑day outings combining forest and waterfront. Expect broad paths and mixed terrain that’s kind to paws, with shade pockets and benches for water breaks. Go early or at golden hour in summer to avoid heat; bring a collapsible bowl and extra bags. Leash rules vary by area—check signage at each entrance and respect protected habitats.

name: Volkspark Friedrichshain
full_description: Historic park with gently rolling paths, rose gardens and the fairy‑tale fountain; dog meadows nearby. Plenty of benches and kiosks for breaks. Expect broad paths and mixed terrain that’s kind to paws, with shade pockets and benches for water breaks. Go early or at golden hour in summer to avoid heat; bring a collapsible bowl and extra bags. Leash rules vary by area—check signage at each entrance and respect protected habitats.

name: Mauerpark & Falkplatz
full_description: Open lawns on the former death strip with markets and buskers on weekends. Great for socialized dogs that enjoy crowds—choose calmer hours if your pup prefers space. Expect broad paths and mixed terrain that’s kind to paws, with shade pockets and benches for water breaks. Go early or at golden hour in summer to avoid heat; bring a collapsible bowl and extra bags. Leash rules vary by area—check signage at each entrance and respect protected habitats.

name: Görlitzer Park
full_description: Wide lawns, paths and playgrounds in Kreuzberg; good as a connector toward the Landwehrkanal promenades. Expect broad paths and mixed terrain that’s kind to paws, with shade pockets and benches for water breaks. Go early or at golden hour in summer to avoid heat; bring a collapsible bowl and extra bags. Leash rules vary by area—check signage at each entrance and respect protected habitats.

name: Volkspark Hasenheide (Dog Run)
full_description: Mix of wooded paths and open lawns; the designated dog run is useful for off‑lead zoomies in a controlled space. Expect broad paths and mixed terrain that’s kind to paws, with shade pockets and benches for water breaks. Go early or at golden hour in summer to avoid heat; bring a collapsible bowl and extra bags. Leash rules vary by area—check signage at each entrance and respect protected habitats.

name: Park am Gleisdreieck
full_description: Reclaimed rail yards turned into linear meadows and paths with play areas and cafés. Great sightlines for training and cycling desensitization. Expect broad paths and mixed terrain that’s kind to paws, with shade pockets and benches for water breaks. Go early or at golden hour in summer to avoid heat; bring a collapsible bowl and extra bags. Leash rules vary by area—check signage at each entrance and respect protected habitats.

name: Volkspark Humboldthain (Flak Tower View)
full_description: Hill paths with staircase climbs to a WWII flak tower viewpoint; mixed woodland and open lawns. Expect broad paths and mixed terrain that’s kind to paws, with shade pockets and benches for water breaks. Go early or at golden hour in summer to avoid heat; bring a collapsible bowl and extra bags. Leash rules vary by area—check signage at each entrance and respect protected habitats.

name: Schlosspark Charlottenburg
full_description: Formal lanes and riverside paths around Berlin’s baroque palace; leashed dogs only and respect quiet zones. Expect broad paths and mixed terrain that’s kind to paws, with shade pockets and benches for water breaks. Go early or at golden hour in summer to avoid heat; bring a collapsible bowl and extra bags. Leash rules vary by area—check signage at each entrance and respect protected habitats.

name: Weißer See (Park am Weißen See)
full_description: Compact lakeside loop with cafés and a swan‑dotted view; busy on weekends—aim for early laps. Expect broad paths and mixed terrain that’s kind to paws, with shade pockets and benches for water breaks. Go early or at golden hour in summer to avoid heat; bring a collapsible bowl and extra bags. Leash rules vary by area—check signage at each entrance and respect protected habitats.

name: Natur-Park Schöneberger Südgelände
full_description: Nature reclaiming an old rail yard; boardwalks, art and meadow habitats. Leashed dogs only; stay on marked paths to protect wildlife. Expect broad paths and mixed terrain that’s kind to paws, with shade pockets and benches for water breaks. Go early or at golden hour in summer to avoid heat; bring a collapsible bowl and extra bags. Leash rules vary by area—check signage at each entrance and respect protected habitats.

name: Café am Neuen See (CANs)
full_description: Tiergarten’s lakeside beer garden and café welcomes leashed dogs on the spacious terrace. Wooden tables under trees, water bowls and easy lake loops before/after. Staff are used to well‑behaved dogs; outdoor tables are shaded and water bowls are usually available. Aim for off‑peak hours if your dog is still practicing calm café manners and bring a mat or chew to help them settle. Always keep your companion leashed and tucked under the table for everyone’s comfort.

name: BRLO Brwhouse (Gleisdreieck)
full_description: Craft‑beer hall built from containers with a generous outdoor area; leashed dogs fit right in at picnic tables. Staff are used to well‑behaved dogs; outdoor tables are shaded and water bowls are usually available. Aim for off‑peak hours if your dog is still practicing calm café manners and bring a mat or chew to help them settle. Always keep your companion leashed and tucked under the table for everyone’s comfort.

name: Silo Coffee
full_description: Beloved specialty‑coffee spot in Friedrichshain with sidewalk seating for people‑watching and calm dog settling. Staff are used to well‑behaved dogs; outdoor tables are shaded and water bowls are usually available. Aim for off‑peak hours if your dog is still practicing calm café manners and bring a mat or chew to help them settle. Always keep your companion leashed and tucked under the table for everyone’s comfort.

name: Zeit für Brot
full_description: Organic bakery famous for giant cinnamon rolls; outside benches welcome polite pups—bring a mat. Staff are used to well‑behaved dogs; outdoor tables are shaded and water bowls are usually available. Aim for off‑peak hours if your dog is still practicing calm café manners and bring a mat or chew to help them settle. Always keep your companion leashed and tucked under the table for everyone’s comfort.

name: Markthalle Neun
full_description: Covered market with surrounding street‑food terraces; choose quieter hours for dogs sensitive to crowds. Staff are used to well‑behaved dogs; outdoor tables are shaded and water bowls are usually available. Aim for off‑peak hours if your dog is still practicing calm café manners and bring a mat or chew to help them settle. Always keep your companion leashed and tucked under the table for everyone’s comfort.

name: 25hours Hotel Bikini Berlin
full_description: Playful design hotel overlooking the zoo and Tiergarten; pet‑friendly rooms make early walks simple. Check size limits and fees before booking, and ask about bowls, beds or welcome treats. Nearby green pockets make early‑morning potty breaks easy; keep wipes and extra bags in your daypack. Quiet, interior rooms are usually best for sound‑sensitive dogs.

name: Hotel Zoo Berlin
full_description: Stylish Ku’damm grande dame that welcomes pets; concierge can suggest quiet routes to Lietzensee or Tiergarten. Check size limits and fees before booking, and ask about bowls, beds or welcome treats. Nearby green pockets make early‑morning potty breaks easy; keep wipes and extra bags in your daypack. Quiet, interior rooms are usually best for sound‑sensitive dogs.

name: Michelberger Hotel
full_description: Creative hub with a leafy courtyard and pet‑friendly policy; Spree riverside paths are moments away. Check size limits and fees before booking, and ask about bowls, beds or welcome treats. Nearby green pockets make early‑morning potty breaks easy; keep wipes and extra bags in your daypack. Quiet, interior rooms are usually best for sound‑sensitive dogs.

name: Kleintierklinik der Freien Universität Berlin (Düppel)
full_description: University small‑animal clinic with 24/7 emergency, advanced imaging and multidisciplinary specialists. Save the phone number in your contacts and note the closest 24/7 alternative for backup. Ask about quiet waiting options if your dog is anxious, and bring medical history or EU Pet Passport if available. For emergencies, call ahead so the team can prepare triage.

name: AniCura Tierklinik Berlin (Lankwitz)
full_description: Large hospital with ER cover, surgical suites and intensive care; easy access via A103/B1. Save the phone number in your contacts and note the closest 24/7 alternative for backup. Ask about quiet waiting options if your dog is anxious, and bring medical history or EU Pet Passport if available. For emergencies, call ahead so the team can prepare triage.

name: Tierklinik Biesdorf (Kleintierzentrum)
full_description: East‑side animal hospital with emergency service, diagnostics and surgery. Save the phone number in your contacts and note the closest 24/7 alternative for backup. Ask about quiet waiting options if your dog is anxious, and bring medical history or EU Pet Passport if available. For emergencies, call ahead so the team can prepare triage.

name: Tierarztpraxis am Treptower Park
full_description: Trusted neighborhood clinic close to large green spaces; clear communication and preventive‑care focus. Save the phone number in your contacts and note the closest 24/7 alternative for backup. Ask about quiet waiting options if your dog is anxious, and bring medical history or EU Pet Passport if available. For emergencies, call ahead so the team can prepare triage.

name: Tierarztpraxis Boxhagener Straße
full_description: Friendly Friedrichshain practice handling routine care and minor surgery; calm, modern waiting area. Save the phone number in your contacts and note the closest 24/7 alternative for backup. name: Fressnapf XXL Berlin‑Lichtenberg
full_description: Huge selection of food, gear and travel accessories; staff can help with harness fitting and muzzle sizing.

name: Hundesalon Fellfreunde
full_description: Low‑stress grooming with coat‑care packages tailored to breed and lifestyle; book ahead for weekends.

name: Rudelbildung – Hundeschule & Tagesbetreuung
full_description: Reward‑based training combined with structured daycare; focus on real‑life city skills like recall and calm café manners.

name: Tempelhofer Feld (dog areas)
full_description: Former airport turned park with zoned off-leash areas and long runways for walks; dogs must be leashed in some zones and during bird breeding season.

name: Grunewaldsee Hundestrand (Dog beach)
full_description: Forest lake with very popular dog beach; huge adjacent off-leash area in Grunewald forest.

name: Grunewald Forest Trails
full_description: Extensive forest network with signed trails; popular with dog walkers. Keep dogs under control and observe posted rules.

name: Café am Neuen See
full_description: Beer garden and restaurant by the lake in Tiergarten; dogs commonly welcomed on terrace.

name: Fressnapf Berlin-Kreuzberg
full_description: Large chain pet store for food, accessories and supplies.

name: Veterinärmedizinisches Zentrum Berlin – Tierarztpraxis Rödiger (24h)
full_description: 24/7 small animal hospital with emergency services.

name: Martin Rütter Hundeschule Berlin (Inh. Sandau)
full_description: Well-known dog training school offering group and individual sessions.
